Selected Answer: B
B. Enforce an internal data access policy: This is directly relevant to controlling access to confidential information. Enforcing an internal data access policy ensures that only authorized personnel have access to sensitive information, based on their role and need-to-know basis. This policy would include mechanisms like access controls, user authentication, and authorization levels, which are essential to safeguard confidential data.

Selected Answer: B
B. Enforce an internal data access policy

Enforcing an internal data access policy is crucial in controlling who can access what information within a business application system. This policy should define the roles and responsibilities of users, specify what data they are allowed to access based on their role, and establish protocols for granting, reviewing, and revoking access rights. Such a policy is central to maintaining the confidentiality of information by ensuring that only authorized individuals have access to sensitive data.

Selected Answer: B
B. Enforce an internal data access policy

Enforcing an internal data access policy is crucial for controlling who has access to confidential information and under what circumstances. This policy should define roles, responsibilities, and permissions for different users or groups within the organization. It should specify what data can be accessed, by whom, and for what purposes. This approach ensures that only authorized personnel have access to sensitive information, reducing the risk of unauthorized retrieval.

questions.question_text: A risk practitioner is developing a set of bottom-up IT risk scenarios. The MOST important time to involve business stakeholders is when:

discussion.content: Why not B？

comments.content: Because validating the risk scenarios involves ensuring that the identified risks are relevant and accurately reflect the potential impact on the business. In this phase, it is crucial to involve business stakeholders to get their input, perspectives, and feedback on the identified risk scenarios. This collaboration helps to ensure that the risk scenarios are aligned with the organization's strategic objectives and that the risks are assessed correctly. It also enhances the credibility of the risk assessment process and the resulting risk register.

KRI effectiveness takes into consideration the following criteria:
• Impact—Indicators of risk with high business impact are more likely to be KRIs.
• Effort—For different indicators that are equivalent in sensitivity, the one that is easier to measure and maintain is preferred.
• Reliability—The indicator must possess a high correlation with the risk and be a good predictor or outcome measure.
• Sensitivity—The indicator must be representative of risk and capable of accurately indicating risk variances.
• Repeatable—A KRI must be repeatable and able to be measured on a regular basis to show trends and patterns in activity and results.

KRI optimization: Sensitivity Management has implemented an automated tool to analyze and report on access control logs based on severity, and the tool generates an excessive number of results. Management performs a risk assessment and decides to configure the monitoring tool to report only on alerts marked “critical.”

questions.question_text: What should be PRIMARILY responsible for establishing an organization's IT risk culture?
Which of the following is the GREATEST benefit to an organization when updates to the risk register are made promptly after the completion of a risk assessment?

discussion.content: I think C is the best answer

The GREATEST benefit to an organization when updates to the risk register are made promptly after the completion of a risk assessment is:

C. Optimized risk treatment decisions

Prompt updates to the risk register ensure that the most current and relevant information about identified risks is available. This allows for timely and informed decision-making regarding risk treatments. When risk treatment decisions are based on the most up-to-date information, the organization can more effectively allocate resources, prioritize actions, and implement appropriate controls to mitigate risks.

While improved communication, enhanced awareness, and better collaboration are all important and beneficial, the primary purpose of promptly updating the risk register is to ensure that risk treatment decisions are based on accurate and current data, thereby optimizing the effectiveness of the risk management process.

Selected Answer: C
C. Optimized risk treatment decisions: This is the most significant benefit. When the risk register is updated promptly after a risk assessment, it ensures that the most current and relevant risk information is available for making informed decisions. Timely updates allow for more accurate and effective risk treatment decisions, as the information is up-to-date and reflective of the current risk environment.

Selected Answer: C
C. Optimized risk treatment decisions

Updating the risk register promptly after a risk assessment ensures that the organization has the most current and accurate information regarding its risks. This, in turn, allows for more effective and optimized risk treatment decisions. When the risk register is up-to-date, it enables the organization to prioritize and allocate resources to manage the most critical risks. It also helps in selecting appropriate risk mitigation strategies, monitoring, and taking timely actions. While other benefits like improved senior management communication, enhanced awareness of risk management, and improved collaboration among risk professionals are important, optimizing risk treatment decisions is typically the most critical outcome of maintaining an updated risk register.
